appDescription: A mobile-first chat application designed to connect the Indian community within different states in the USA. It features state-specific public chat rooms, private messaging, and AI-powered content moderation and categorization to identify community needs.

coreFeatures.description: User registration and login via email and password. Session persistence is handled by Firebase Auth. Includes password reset functionality.
Users have profiles with first name, last name, username, email, phone, city, state, and a profile picture. Profiles are editable.
State-specific public group chat rooms and one-on-one private chats. Supports text and image messages with pagination. Users can edit/delete their own messages within 24 hours.

An AI flow automatically analyzes messages in public chats to detect user needs. It categorizes messages into types like 'Jobs', 'Housing', 'Marketplace', etc., and creates a structured 'requirement' post.
A dedicated page that displays all AI-detected requirements. Users can filter requirements by category and create their own posts. This page serves as a community needs board.
A page displaying special deals and offers for the community. Admins can add, edit, and delete offers. Non-admin users see a CTA to contact an admin to post an offer.
A protected page for administrators. It displays charts and key metrics about requirements and offers.
A mobile-friendly bottom navigation bar provides easy access to Chat, Requirements, Offers, and Profile. An Admin link appears for authorized users.

firestore.description: Room ID is the state name for public chats (e.g., 'hawaii') or a composite ID ('uid1_uid2') for private chats.

schema.title: string
schema.states: array<string> (list of state values, e.g., ['california', 'texas'], or ['all'])

genkitFlows.name: categorizeMessageFlow
genkitFlows.description: Analyzes a user's chat message to determine if it represents a specific need or requirement.

output.title: string (A concise title for the post, e.g., 'Roommate Needed')

genkitFlows.trigger: A Firestore trigger on document creation in `chats/{roomId}/messages/{messageId}`. It processes messages from public chats and creates a new document in the `requirements` collection if the category is not 'General Chat' or 'Other'.

securityRules.description: Defines access control for the Firestore database.

permissions.write: Allow only if the user is modifying their own document (request.auth.uid == userId).

permissions.read: Allow if it is a public chat OR if the user is a member of the private chat.
permissions.create: Allow if user is authenticated and the author of the message.
permissions.update: Allow if user is the author of the message (for editing or soft-deleting).
Allow if user is the author or an admin.
permissions.delete: Allow if user is the author or an admin.

permissions.write: Allow if user is an admin.
